co.cask.cdap.api.spark

Class AbstractSpark

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cask.cdap.internal.api.AbstractProgramDatasetConfigurable
      • co.cask.cdap.internal.api.AbstractPluginConfigurable<SparkConfigurer>
        • co.cask.cdap.api.spark.AbstractSpark
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProgramLifecycle<SparkClientContext>, Spark

    @Beta
public abstract class AbstractSpark
extends co.cask.cdap.internal.api.AbstractPluginConfigurable<SparkConfigurer>
implements Spark, ProgramLifecycle<SparkClientContext>
    This abstract class provides a default implementation of Spark methods for easy extension.

        protected final void setMainClassName(String mainClassName)
        Sets the Spark job main class name in specification. The main method of this class will be called to run the Spark job
        Parameters:

      • initialize

        public final void initialize(SparkClientContext context)
                      throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: ProgramLifecycle
        Initializes a Program.

        This method will be called only once per ProgramLifecycle instance.

        Specified by:
        initialize in interface ProgramLifecycle<SparkClientContext>
        Parameters:
        context - An instance of RuntimeContext
        Throws:
        Exception - If there is any error during initialization.

      • initialize

        protected void initialize()
                   throws Exception
        Classes derived from AbstractSpark can override this method to initialize the Spark. SparkClientContext will be available in this method using getContext(). Default implementation of this method calls the deprecated beforeSubmit(co.cask.cdap.api.spark.SparkClientContext) method.
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is any error in initializing the Spark

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from interface: ProgramLifecycle
        Destroy is the last thing that gets called before the program is shutdown. So, if there are any cleanups then they can be specified here.
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface ProgramLifecycle<SparkClientContext>

      • getContext

        protected final SparkClientContext getContext()
        Return an instance of the SparkClientContext.
